intro: Thapsia garganica f. decussata, commonly known as the Garganica thapsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
